title: How to Join a Minecraft Minigame Server: Mineplex Alternatives

steps.title: Hypixel
steps.content: Hypixel Hypixel is probably one of the most well-known Minecraft servers, and it's got a similar premise to Mineplexâ€”the entirety of the server's gameplay is based around minigames. If you miss Mineplex, this is a great alternative to start with. To connect to Hypixel, go to Multiplayer > Add Server , then enter the server address mc.hypixel.net .

steps.title: CubeCraft
steps.content: CubeCraft CubeCraft is a crossplay (between Bedrock and Java) server that also offers a ton of fun minigames to play. If you play on Bedrock, there are a ton of fun customization options you can try out as well. To connect to CubeCraft, go to Multiplayer > Add Server , then enter the server address play.cubecraft.net .

steps.title: Performium
steps.content: Performium If you're playing the Java Edition of Minecraft, you might want to try out Performium. It's another minigame server that mainly features a recreation of Among Us, but there are other fun games to try. To connect to Performium, go to Multiplayer > Add Server , then enter the server address mc.performium.net .

steps.title: The Hive
steps.content: The Hive On the flip side, if you're playing Bedrock Edition, you might want to try out the Hive. It offers a ton of unique and fun minigames, plus it always is full of a ton of people to play with. To connect to The Hive, go to Multiplayer > Add Server , then enter the server address geo.hivebedrock.net .

steps.title: Open Minecraft on your computer.
steps.content: Open Minecraft on your computer. Currently, you can only connect to Minecraft servers from a computer. Note: The Mineplex server was shut down in 2023. We have retained the steps below for archival purposes, but be aware that you can no longer join the Mineplex server.

steps.title: Update to the latest version
steps.content: Update to the latest version . To check that you have the latest version, look at the bottom left corner of the Minecraft menu when you first open the game. Click Edit Profile , then find "Use version" in the pop-up menu and select Use Latest Version from the drop-down bar next to it.

steps.title: Open the multiplayer menu.
steps.content: Open the multiplayer menu. Log in to your profile, then select Multiplayer on the main menu.

steps.title: Click the Add Server button.
steps.content: Click the Add Server button. You will need to be connected to the internet for this next step to work.

steps.title: Type a server name.
steps.content: Type a server name. You can actually type anything you like into the Server Name field. Using the name of the server is recommended so you can easily find it on your list of servers, if you decide to add more later.

steps.title: Enter the server address.
steps.content: Enter the server address. If a server has multiple server addresses, pick one that's closer to where you live (usually denoted by the first two letters in the server address URL).

steps.title: Hit Done.
steps.content: Hit Done. You should see a new server on your list. If there is a blank space with "cannot resolve host name," try again and make sure you type the server address correctly. If the space says "cannot connect to server," your internet might be having trouble. Try plugging into Ethernet if you are on WiFi, or just try again later.
